meanings.definition: To charge (a particle) with more than one unit of electric charge.
meanings.sent1: She hypercharges her phone every night to make sure it doesn't run out of battery.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic hypercharges the car battery to ensure it starts in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The chef hypercharges the recipe with extra spices for a burst of flavor.
meanings.sent4: The artist hypercharges the painting with vibrant colors to make it stand out.
meanings.sent5: The teacher hypercharges the lesson with fun activities to keep the students engaged.

meanings.definition: The electric charge of a hyperon.
meanings.sent1: The hypercharges of the particles determine their interactions in the experiment.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the hypercharges of subatomic particles to understand their behavior.
meanings.sent3: The hypercharges of the batteries in the toy store seemed to have a mind of their own.
meanings.sent4: The hypercharges of the stars in the night sky create a beautiful cosmic dance.
meanings.sent5: The hypercharges of the magnets attract and repel with fascinating force.
